rooms.name: Standard Room, Side Sea View
rooms.description: Spacious and modern, the Standard Side Sea View Rooms boast a balcony offering a partial view of the sparkling sea and the village. Guests can expect plenty of attention of detail as well as contemporary amenities including air conditioning, a minibar, a television, complimentary Wi-Fi and more.

resort.name: Ischia
resort.description: The largest of the islands in the Gulf of Naples, Ischia rises out of the blue Tyrrhenian Sea like a rugged yet peaceful giant. Visitors come here looking to relax in luxurious resorts, pristine beaches, natural thermal spas and mud baths, as well as indulge in amazing Italian food. Arriving at Ischia by ferry from Naples, you’ll notice the Castle Aragonese, which towers over the cobalt blue sea and is only connected to the rest of the island by a narrow paved walkway. With over 1,500 years to its name, it has been used both as a fortification against invaders and pirates, as well as a convent, and you can easily explore these different waves of history that have swept over the island. Today, Ischia is a place that offers full relaxation with stunning beaches, clear waters for swimming and various water sports, as well as the opportunity to explore charming little villages and captivating nature further inland. The island is furthermore home to numerous thermal springs and mud spas. From the coastal town of Sant’ Angelo, you can trek up the steps of the hillside overlooking the bay, to find the ancient Roman baths of Cavascura. Hollowed out by the rock, visitors can enjoy therapeutic treatments here, as well as saunas, mud baths and showers, which are all said to have a soothing effect on various ailments.

keyFacts: The hotel is just a short walk from the seafront
The on-site restaurant specialises in local dishes and freshly caught seafood
The hotel is just a few steps from a thermal park where guests can enjoy massages and treatments
gettingThere: The hotel is located 58 kilometres (approximately two hours and 10 minutes by car and ferry) from Naples International Airport (NAP)
name: La Palma Hotel
description:
Located in the historic centre of Sant’Angelo, Hotel La Palma is nothing short of an Italian dream come true on the island of Ischia. Boasting a central location that allows guests to explore the picturesque village while also just being a stone’s throw away from the seafront, the hotel offers exceptional hospitality that makes your stay one of the highest standard. 


Just a few steps away from the property you’ll find the Tropical Thermal Park, an oasis of wellness and relaxation that comprises 10 thermal pools of various temperatures, as well as there being a full menu of massages and treatments available at the hotel’s on-site spa. Hotel La Palma also has a restaurant, which provides extraordinary sea views and specialises in local dishes and freshly caught seafood. Complimentary Wi-Fi is available throughout for your convenience.
surroundings:
The largest of the islands in the Gulf of Naples, Ischia rises out of the blue Tyrrhenian Sea like a rugged yet peaceful giant. Visitors come here looking to indulge in luxurious resorts, pristine beaches, natural thermal spas and mud baths, and of course, amazing Italian food. Arriving at the island by ferry from Naples, you’ll notice Castle Aragonese, which towers over the cobalt sea and is only connected to the rest of the island by a narrow paved walkway. With over 1,500 years to its name, it has been used as both a fortification and a convent. 
Today, Ischia offers stunning beaches and clear waters for swimming and various water sports, as well as the opportunity to explore charming little villages and captivating nature further inland. The island is home to numerous thermal springs and mud spas. From the coastal town of Sant’Angelo, you can trek up the steps of the hillside overlooking the bay, to find the ancient Roman baths of Cavascura. Hollowed out by the rock, visitors can enjoy therapeutic treatments here, as well as saunas, mud baths and showers.
